**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug

**What happened**:
kubelet.exe crashes on Windows Server Core. 

**What you expected to happen**:
Kubelet running and joining to the cluster.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Build kubelet.exe from master and run it on a machine with Core (UI-less).

**Anything else we need to know?**:
There was a dependency introduced in PR #50396 on [this package](https://github.com/lxn/win/). This loads `OpenGL32.dll`, which isn't present on the UI-less Windows Core variant, thus causing a panic:

    panic: The specified module could not be found.

    goroutine 1 [running]:
    k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/lxn/win.MustLoadLibrary(0x34a64bd, 0xc, 0xc)
            .../local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/lxn/win/win.go:48 +0x73
    k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/lxn/win.init.8()
            .../local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/lxn/win/opengl32.go:117 +0x41
    k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/github.com/lxn/win.init()
            <autogenerated>:1 +0x81
    k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/winstats.init()
            <autogenerated>:1 +0x77
    ...

Though the package is necessary, OpenGL is not. lxn/win#23 is open on the package to be Core-friendly, but it doesn't seem to be going anywhere.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Built from #51063 directly.
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: n/a
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Windows Server Standard Core 1709
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 16299.15.amd64fre.rs3_release.170928-1534
